intro: Kalimeris altaica, commonly known as the Altai fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Kalimeris altaica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
